input:

13:42 Event: Ball out of play
14:02 Event: Throw-in by Chelsea
14:07 Caption: This should have been a goal! Willian (Chelsea) sends a killer pass into the box, but Diego Costa can't trick the opposition's defence and loses possession.
14:57 Caption: Baba Rahman (Chelsea) attempts to find the head of one of his teammates with a promising cross into the box, but a defender outjumps the attackers and averts the threat.
16:25 Caption: Diego Costa (Chelsea) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away.
16:48 Caption: Some great controlled play and passing from Maccabi Tel Aviv. They are increasing their possession of the ball and trying to open up the opposition's defence to hit them swiftly on the break.
17:02 Event: Ball out of play
17:09 Event: Throw-in by Chelsea
17:46 Event: Foul by Maccabi Tel Aviv
17:56 Event: Indirect free-kick by Chelsea
18:01 Caption: Tal Ben Haim (Maccabi Tel Aviv) deprives his opponent of the ball, but the referee blows his whistle for a foul. He's not happy with the decision!
18:15 Event: Shots off target by Chelsea
18:16 Event: Ball out of play
18:55 Event: Clearance by Maccabi Tel Aviv
19:00 Event: Ball out of play
19:01 Caption: Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box after picking up a pass, but produces a poor effort that sails high over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Maccabi Tel Aviv.
19:07 Event: Throw-in by Chelsea
19:21 Event: Ball out of play
19:27 Caption: Oscar (Chelsea) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge. The ball goes out of play and Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick.
19:28 Caption: Corner kick. Willian (Chelsea) is ready to send the ball into the box.
19:45 Event: Corner by Chelsea
19:48 Event: Shots on target by Chelsea
19:48 Event: Goal by Chelsea
19:58 Caption: Gary Cahill (Chelsea) connects with the resulting corner kick deep into the box, but the keeper gets a glove to his header and pushes it onto the left post.
19:59 Caption: A shot is blocked but the rebound lands at the feet of Gary Cahill (Chelsea) who fires the ball into the back of the net.
20:19 Event: Kick-off by Maccabi Tel Aviv
21:44 Event: Foul by Chelsea
21:56 Event: Indirect free-kick by Chelsea

24:30 Event: Throw-in by Chelsea

25:07 Event: Indirect free-kick by Chelsea
25:59 Event: Ball out of play

26:20 Caption: The ball is cleared after Dor Peretz (Maccabi Tel Aviv) attempted to dribble past an opposing player. Maccabi Tel Aviv get a corner.
26:33 Caption: The corner by Tal Ben Haim II. (Maccabi Tel Aviv) lacks accuracy as it's hit with too much power.
26:36 Event: Corner by Maccabi Tel Aviv

29:30 Event: Ball out of play

30:08 Event: Clearance by Maccabi Tel Aviv
31:27 Event: Shots off target by Chelsea
31:28 Event: Ball out of play
31:39 Caption: Diego Costa (Chelsea) attempts to find his teammate with a short pass into the box. Eden Hazard collects the ball, but his attack is thwarted by the defence.
31:51 Event: Clearance by Maccabi Tel Aviv
32:38 Caption: The Maccabi Tel Aviv players are exchanging short passes in an attempt to create a shooting opportunity.

33:35 Event: Ball out of play

33:49 Event: Clearance by Chelsea
34:33 Event: Foul by Maccabi Tel Aviv
34:49 Caption: Alberto Undiano Mallenco has a clear sight and sees a foul from Carlos Garcia (Maccabi Tel Aviv). Chelsea have been awarded a free kick.
35:26 Event: Indirect free-kick by Chelsea
36:04 Caption: Willian (Chelsea) fires the resultant free kick towards the left post, but the keeper makes a brilliant save and denies him the chance to score.

36:13 Event: Indirect free-kick by Chelsea
36:52 Caption: Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) delivers a lovely cross into the penalty area. Nevertheless, an opposition defender is alert and averts the danger with a brilliant clearance.

37:20 Event: Ball out of play
37:39 Event: Corner by Chelsea
37:42 Event: Shots off target by Chelsea
37:43 Event: Ball out of play
38:03 Caption: Diego Costa (Chelsea) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The ball goes out of play. Chelsea are awarded a corner kick.
38:13 Event: Clearance by Maccabi Tel Aviv
38:17 Caption: Willian (Chelsea) takes a short corner kick.
38:54 Caption: Oscar (Chelsea) receives an accurate pass and attempts to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range strike. Unfortunately for him, his effort goes high above the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Maccabi Tel Aviv will have a goal kick.

39:17 Event: Foul by Maccabi Tel Aviv

41:23 Event: Indirect free-kick by Chelsea
41:27 Event: Ball out of play
41:53 Event: Corner by Chelsea
42:00 Caption: Oscar (Chelsea) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Chelsea.
42:09 Event: Shots on target by Chelsea
42:19 Caption: The corner from Willian (Chelsea) is cleared away by the defence.
42:36 Caption: Eden Hazard (Chelsea) picks up a pass and unleashes a low shot towards goal, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Predrag Rajkovic.
43:04 Event: Ball out of play
43:15 Event: Corner by Chelsea
43:16 Caption: Diego Costa (Chelsea) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge. Corner kick. Chelsea will have an opportunity.
43:35 Caption: Willian (Chelsea) quickly takes the corner kick with a short pass.
44:01 Event: Ball out of play
44:07 Caption: Abdul Rahman Baba (Chelsea) looks to break free, but an opposing player clears the ball away. The ball goes out of play and Maccabi Tel Aviv will have a goal kick.
44:27 Event: Clearance by Maccabi Tel Aviv
44:59 Caption: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
45:01 Caption: The opening 45 minutes weren't very eventful and the game could be described as an average one. The visitors were more active and dominated the home side in the first half, who weren't able to keep up. The home side relies mostly on counter-attacks for their chances, while the away team adopts the opposite approach of possession football.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Maccabi Tel Aviv
00:01 Caption: The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

The ball would have probably ended up inside the right post. The linesman points to the corner flag, Maccabi Tel Aviv are going to take it.

30:50 Caption: Oscar (Chelsea) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.
31:08 Event: Goal by Chelsea
31:37 Caption: It's a goal! Oscar (Chelsea) does well to meet a cross inside the box and strikes a perfect header past the goalkeeper into the middle of the goal.

40:49 Caption: Pedro (Chelsea) makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box and produces a poor effort that sails miles wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Maccabi Tel Aviv.
41:12 Event: Clearance by Maccabi Tel Aviv
41:30 Event: Ball out of play

42:19 Caption: Chelsea seem to be finding their feet as they enjoy some possession. Great movement by the offensive players allows the defenders to set up the attack.
42:48 Event: Shots off target by Chelsea
42:49 Event: Ball out of play
42:57 Caption: Pedro (Chelsea) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though. The ball goes out of play and Maccabi Tel Aviv will have a goal kick.
43:16 Event: Substitution by Maccabi Tel Aviv
43:30 Event: Clearance by Maccabi Tel Aviv

43:34 Event: Ball out of play

44:15 Event: Corner by Maccabi Tel Aviv
44:21 Event: Ball out of play

44:48 Caption: Eden Ben Basat (Maccabi Tel Aviv) works the corner short.
44:57 Event: Shots off target by Chelsea
44:58 Event: Ball out of play
45:02 Caption: Diego Costa (Chelsea) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender. The ball goes out of play. Chelsea are awarded a corner kick.
45:35 Event: Corner by Chelsea
45:37 Event: Goal by Chelsea
45:58 Caption: Oscar (Chelsea) goes over to take the corner kick and it looks like he will send the ball into the penalty box.
45:59 Caption: Oscar takes over corner duties and expertly finds Kurt Zouma (Chelsea), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the middle of the goal. The score is now 0:2.
48:40 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
48:59 Caption: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. The away team was superior on the pitch today. The home side were defending patiently to win the ball off the opponent and launch the counter. However, the away side moved the ball around and were waiting for a gap to appear in the home side's defence.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
On a brisk evening, football fans were treated to a captivating encounter as Chelsea faced off against Maccabi Tel Aviv at Bloomfield Stadium. The match, full of pulsating action, ended with a resounding victory for Chelsea, much to the dismay of the home crowd. Chelsea, the visitors, dominated the proceedings from the start and showcased why they are regarded as one of the top teams in European football. Here's a detailed account of how the match unfolded, minute by minute, highlighting key moments and player performances that led to the final scoreline of 0-4 in favor of Chelsea.

The game kicked off with Chelsea taking the initiative right from the start. With only 15 seconds into the match, the visitors set the tone by drawing a foul from the Maccabi Tel Aviv players. The referee awarded Chelsea an indirect free-kick, signaling their intent to control the game early on. The first few minutes were characterized by a series of throw-ins and clearances as both teams tried to find their rhythm.

In the 4th minute, Maccabi Tel Aviv registered the first shot of the game, albeit off-target. This was promptly followed by a clearance from Chelsea, who were alert to the attacking threat posed by the home side. Maccabi Tel Aviv's early aggressiveness was met with a sound defensive strategy from Chelsea, who efficiently neutralized their opponent’s advances. 

Chelsea's patience began to pay off as they started to establish their presence in Maccabi's half. Despite a series of fouls and indirect free-kicks dominating the early exchanges, Chelsea managed to carve out the first clear opportunity in the 14th minute. Willian sent a killer pass into the box, but Diego Costa was unable to capitalize, losing possession to the opposition defense.

The visitors continued their probing attacks and were rewarded in the 20th minute. Gary Cahill rose above the Maccabi defense to connect with a well-delivered corner kick. Though the keeper managed to parry his header onto the left post, Cahill was quick to react, netting the rebound to give Chelsea their opening goal. With this goal, Chelsea took a 1-0 lead, setting the stage for what would be an eventful first half.

Following the goal, Maccabi Tel Aviv attempted to regain control, hoping to find an equalizer. However, their efforts were repeatedly thwarted by a resolute Chelsea defense. As the first half progressed, Chelsea continued to dominate possession and create openings, though Maccabi Tel Aviv did manage some sporadic forays into Chelsea's territory.

Diego Costa and Eden Hazard were at the heart of Chelsea's attacking moves, both players showcasing their skills and creating numerous chances. However, Maccabi Tel Aviv’s defense, despite being under immense pressure, managed to hold firm for most of the first half.

As halftime approached, tensions flared with Maccabi Tel Aviv being reduced to ten men. Tal Ben Haim received his marching orders after a reckless foul, drastically tipping the scales in favor of Chelsea. This red card further emboldened Chelsea, who piled on the pressure in the dying minutes of the first half but were unable to add to their score before the break.

The second half began with Maccabi Tel Aviv kicking off and immediately trying to establish an attacking foothold. However, Chelsea’s superior numbers and tactical acumen soon became evident. They continued to dominate possession and looked dangerous with every forward move.

Chelsea's relentless pressure paid off again in the 27th minute. Willian was spectacular, converting a direct free-kick into a stunning goal that left the goalkeeper with no chance. The ball curled brilliantly into the left post, doubling Chelsea's advantage to 2-0. Willian's goal was a testament to Chelsea's superior play and a blow to Maccabi Tel Aviv's hopes of a comeback.

With Maccabi Tel Aviv struggling to cope with the numerical disadvantage and Chelsea's relentless assaults, it wasn’t long before the visitors struck again. In the 31st minute, Oscar who had been a constant menace found himself perfectly positioned to meet a cross from the wing. His header was expertly executed, finding the back of the net and extending Chelsea's lead to 3-0.

As the match progressed, Chelsea's dominance became even more apparent. Jose Mourinho's tactical changes further cemented Chelsea’s control over the match. Mid-game substitutions brought fresh legs with Pedro replacing Eden Hazard, ensuring that Chelsea maintained their intensity.

Maccabi Tel Aviv, despite being down, did not give up and created some opportunities of their own. Eran Zahavi and Elazar Dasa displayed flashes of brilliance but were consistently repelled by Chelsea's robust defense and the goalkeeping prowess of Asmir Begovic. Attempts from Zahavi were neatly saved, denying the home side any chance of pulling a goal back.

With a comfortable lead, Chelsea played with fluidity and confidence, creating several more scoring chances. The final goal of the match came from a well-executed corner in the 45th minute of the second half. Oscar's delivery into the box found Kurt Zouma, who rose highest to head the ball into the middle of the goal, cementing the 4-0 scoreline.

As the final whistle approached, Chelsea continued to control the game, ensuring that Maccabi Tel Aviv had no route back into the match. The final score reflected Chelsea's dominance and the tactical masterclass from their manager.

In summary, this match was a thorough demonstration of Chelsea’s quality. From the solid defensive performances that nullified Maccabi Tel Aviv's attacks, to the clinical finishing that ensured a comfortable victory, every aspect of their game was impressive. Key players like Gary Cahill, who opened the scoring, and Willian, whose stunning free-kick underlined the victory, were instrumental in this dominant performance. The red card to Tal Ben Haim undoubtedly played a part in tilting the game further in Chelsea’s favor; however, it was their overall superior play and tactical nous that secured this resounding victory.

For Maccabi Tel Aviv, the match was a tough lesson in the intensity and quality required at this level. Despite the setback of being reduced to ten men, they showed flashes of promise, particularly in the efforts late in the second half. But ultimately, Chelsea's class and experience shone through, ensuring that the visitors left with a well-deserved three points.

The 4-0 scoreline will certainly bolster Chelsea's confidence as they progress through the competition, while Maccabi Tel Aviv will need to regroup and learn from this experience as they prepare for their next fixtures. This match was a compelling watch and a reminder of the sheer unpredictability and excitement that football brings.
